com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.process
Class VirtualProcess

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Process
      com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.process.VirtualProcess

public class VirtualProcess
extends Process

An implementation of Process that represents a pseudo-process running in an isolated ClassLoader within a JVM.

Copyright (c) 2011. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Jonathan Knight, Brian Oliver

invoke

public <T> T invoke(String className,
                    String methodName)
Invoke the specified method on the specified class within the current pseudo-process isolation.

If the method is not static the class must have a default empty constructor to allow an instance of it to be created.

This allows methods to be called that will execute as though they were part of the current pseudo-process' isolation. Any return value from the method is returned to the caller. As the method will execute within another ClassLoader it is best to only use Java primitives or classes that are part of the JRE as return types.

Parameters:
className - - the name of the class to run the specified method on
methodName - - the method to run
Returns:
any return value from invoking the method
